sentences.sContent: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.sCn: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

sentences.sContent: ...a new study that began with about 1000 children in New Zealand has tracked how a child's low self-control can predict poor health，money troubles and even a criminal record in their adult years...
...While some economists predict continued recovery in the future...
...do predict if poor children will move up the economic ladder as adults...
...no one can accurately predict where this technology will take us...
...Amazon is trying to predict what we will order...
...Just as no one could predict what would happen with social media in the last decade...
...Will it transform our ability to predict and make decisions about the future...
...the two measures most commonly used to predict college performance...

remMethod.val: pre(预先) ＋ dict(说) → 预言， 预告， 预测

trans.tranCn: 预言， 预告， 预测
trans.tranOther: to say that something will happen, before it happens
